critique: This document establishes positions within the Federal Farm Board and outlines a process for determining salaries. It doesn't directly address ideological issues, immigration, executive power, federalism, national security, or social inclusion. The creation of the Federal Farm Board and the hiring of experts suggests some government intervention in the agricultural economy. The document itself doesn't seem to strongly favor any particular political ideology. The mention of securing an advisory opinion from the Personnel Classification Board suggests a desire for some standardization and oversight, but the ultimate decision on compensation remains with the Federal Farm Board.
